title: (...) For Dummies book series covers
content:
Hi there,

I want to do a fake "for dummies" book as a gift for a friend of mine, but I can't find out which typeface is used for the "pour les nuls", seems like a serifed Papyrus like font but is it just a logo ? Well is someone has a clue, let me know.

Cheers.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106192342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pour-les-nuls_6111.jpg)
author: kuroneko

comments.content: Probably a logo, but add an effect to [FF Dolores](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106192342/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_dolores/) and you're close.
I think we had this before but can't seem to find the thread.

Would this help?

[http://www.webfontlist.com/pages/station.asp?font=10781&x=Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106192342/http:/www.webfontlist.com/pages/station.asp?font=10781&x=Fonts "http://www.webfontlist.com/pages/station.asp?font=10781&x=Fonts")

It is not the same - but it is a good imitation of the English version of "for Dummies...."
